result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:45 AM Malcolm John Leo Mulwa appears via zoom,  Atty Michelle M Erdman appears via zoom,  DA Halle E. Hatch for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch and Atty Erdman would like to set a plea hearing. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 11:50 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2023 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:30 pm.

1:05 AM Defendant Malcolm John Leo Mulwa in Court, Atty Michelle M Erdman appears via zoom, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch calls Officer Derek Hokanen. S/T. DA Hatch questions Officer. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Erdman. DA Hatch is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over, Atty Erdman argues. DA Hatch argues, Atty Erdman argues. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Order on Victim's Petition for Bond Modification.  - Request to remove no contact granted; however, the defendant must sign a new bond.  The current bond including the no contact order, remains in effect until the Clerk of Court receives the signed the bond.

Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
DE appears via zoom

2:36 PM Defendant Malcolm John Leo Mulwa appears via zoom, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. The Court was notified that DE qualifies for PD but they do not have an attorney appointed at this time. DE waives the time limits.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. DA Hatch is requesting a PH, DE has no objection. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:41 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: from Court Commissioner Gavic to PD letter requesting continuance.  "The Defendant must appear, in that there has not been a waiver of the time requirement.  The Court will allow an appearance via Zoom if the Defendant wishes to do so.  It can be addressed as a Status but the waiver must be addressed."  *Clerk emailed PD w/Zoom information.

Letter from PD requesting a continuance or remote appearance.  Defendant qualifies for PD but requesting additional time to find counsel.  Clerk contacted DA, she is requesting hearing remain on the calendar for victim but changed to a Status.

3:02 PM Defendant Malcolm John Leo Mulwa appears from Jail via video, Atty Derek W Sanders appears by phone, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DA Hatch will correct the complaint on dates. Waives reading. DA Hatch is requesting a $1,000.00 CB w/conditions of NC w/S.M.O., her residence or her place of employment and AS, Atty Sanders argues, Atty Hatch argues. Court orders $500.00 w/conditions as requested. Court confirms address. Prelim demanded. DE does qualify for PD. Court adjourned at 3:18 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
